page.title: 07STANIBY VILLAGE II
page.content: own some part of their land. Two local beauty spots in the Stainby area which were originally a quarry and railway cutting respectively, which supported abundant wild life flora and fauna have been taken over as rubbish tips and are being infilled - thus destroying this heritage. There are no amenities in Stainby - the only pub closed many years ago, and the school within the last decade, both are now private residences. The Church is still a focal point. St. Peter's was built in 1900, and is a fine stone church boasting a magnificent organ - now in need of urgent repair - and a lovely chiming clock which has recently been repaired at a cost of Â£375. Communion Service is sadly held only once a month, and the parishioners through very loyal seldom reach over the dozen mark.
